definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: That film caused public revulsion, not least among the education circles.
sentences.chinese: 該電影引起公憤，特別是教育界的深惡。

sentences.english: It outraged the public that the local authority decided to close the road.
sentences.chinese: 當局決定封閉該路引起了公憤。

sentences.english: The arbitrary police action provoked the public.
sentences.chinese: 警察的專橫行爲激起了公憤。

sentences.english: But the fate of Gusta, Lilly, Karel, Pedro and Soko has sparked outrage in the local media.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩們的遭遇在當地媒體激起了公憤。

sentences.english: Nine activists were killed, sparking international outrage.
sentences.chinese: 這一事件激起了國際公憤。

sentences.english: After the outrage comes the reform.
sentences.chinese: 公憤之後迎來了這場改革。

sentences.english: He incurred the odium of everyone by sacking the old caretaker.
sentences.chinese: 他因解僱老管理員而激起公憤。

sentences.english: Liu came under fire for reacting slowly after Morakot.
sentences.chinese: 劉兆玄因在莫拉克後反應遲緩而引起公憤。

sentences.english: The public angered by what a lady legislator said to close down the Consumers'Foundation.
sentences.chinese: 一位女立法委員說要關閉消費者基金會而引起了公憤。

sentences.english: Americans are outraged by both Wall Street fat cats and the UAW job bank.
sentences.chinese: 華爾街的碩鼠和汽車工人聯合會已經激起了美國公憤。

definition: to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
